metadata.description: Combined monster, rare monster, stronghold, and heroic data for CxN Wiki lookup tool

categories.name: Normal Monsters
categories.description: Normal monster squads that appear on the map (Captains only)

categories.name: Rare Monsters
categories.description: Rare monster squads that appear on the map (Hero only)

categories.name: Strongholds
categories.description: Regular strongholds that can be attacked for resources and valor points

categories.name: Cursed Strongholds
categories.description: Cursed strongholds with Master Coins rewards

categories.name: Citadels
categories.description: Elven Citadels requiring siege and specific troop compositions

troop_counter_guide.description: Use these troops to counter enemy types

Rare Elf Squad.reason: Heavy Mounted troops with high vs. Ranged bonus

Rare Inferno Squad.reason: Ranged troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Undead Squad.reason: Ranged troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Barbarian Squad.reason: Flying troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Elf Squad.reason: Mounted troops with vs. Ranged bonus, Giants vs. Beasts

Rare Inferno Squad.reason: Mounted troops with vs. Ranged bonus, Giants vs. Beasts

Rare Undead Squad.reason: Mounted troops with vs. Ranged bonus, Giants vs. Beasts

Rare Elf Squad.reason: Ranged troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Inferno Squad.reason: Ranged troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Undead Squad.reason: Ranged troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Barbarian Squad.reason: Heavy Melee troops with vs. Mounted bonus

Rare Cursed Squad.reason: Heavy Melee troops with vs. Mounted bonus

Rare Elf Squad.reason: Elemental Ranged with vs. Dragons bonus

Rare Inferno Squad.reason: Elemental Ranged with vs. Dragons bonus

Rare Undead Squad.reason: Mounted troops with Giants vs. Beasts

Rare Barbarian Squad.reason: Flying troops with high vs. Melee bonus

Rare Cursed Squad.reason: Flying troops with high vs. Melee bonus

10.strategy: Send ONLY Archers and Catapults. Can be done with 1 Warregals (No casualties)

15.strategy: Send ONLY Riders and Catapults. Can be done with 3-5 Warregals

20.strategy: Spearmen or Flying for minimum casualties. Can be done with 300 Warregals and 1 Captain without equipment

25.strategy: Can be done with 4,200 lvl 5 Cats and 76k lvl 6 Spearmen or 530 Warregals

30.strategy: Can be done with 1120 lvl 2 Warregals and 1 Captain without equipment

20.strategy: 2150 Cats IV and 30K Spearmen IV with Aydae 73, Brann 76

25.strategy: 3k Cats VI, 15k Spearmen V and 26k Spearmen VI. Cost to revive: 1.5-2.62k Gold

16.reason: Heavy Ranged and Mounted enemy composition

17.reason: Elemental Melee with vs. Ranged bonus

18.reason: Elemental Melee with vs. Ranged bonus

19.reason: Beast Melee with vs. Ranged bonus

20.reason: Giant Melee with vs. Mounted bonus

25.reason: Giant Melee with vs. Mounted bonus

26.reason: Giant Ranged with vs. Melee bonus

29.reason: Elemental Melee with high vs. Mounted

35.reason: Elemental Ranged with high vs. Melee

36.reason: Heavy Melee with vs. Mounted bonus

37.reason: Heavy Ranged with vs. Flying bonus

38.reason: Heavy Mounted with vs. Ranged bonus

40.reason: Heavy Flying with vs. Melee bonus

42.reason: Heavy Ranged with vs. Flying bonus

43.reason: Heavy Mounted with vs. Ranged bonus

10.strategy: ~200 Tier II Catapults + 2,000+ Ranged troops. Archers and flying units hit safely from behind siege.

15.strategy: ~450 Tier III Catapults + mixed mounted forces. Mounted troops are fast with good siege synergy.

20.strategy: ~800 Tier IV Catapults + large melee force. Heavy infantry recommended for sustained tankiness.

25.strategy: ~3,200 Tier V Catapults + very large melee army. Requires massive siege and army investment.
